shorts.title: RailRiders split doubleheader with Buffalo
shorts.description: The Scranton/Wilkes-Barre RailRiders split a doubleheader with the Buffalo Bisons on Thursday night at Sahlen Field, winning Game 1, 5-3, before losing, 4-3, in extras. In Game 1, the RailRiders took a three-run lead in the second inning, as Bryan De La Cruz had a two-run double and Braden Shewmake hit an RBI single against Blue Jays top prospect Trey Yesavage. Buffalo answered in the bottom of the third off Sean Boyle, when RJ Schreck hit an RBI double and Yohendrick Pinango’s RBI single cut the deficit to 3-2. Boyle walked four and hit one, but held the Bisons to […]

shorts.title: GAMEFACE: LFC Capsules, Week 1
shorts.description: NANTICOKE AREA AT 1-NORTH POCONO When: Friday, 7 p.m. Where: North Pocono Trojans Stadium. Last: North Pocono, 46-7. The buzz: North Pocono returns most of its starting lineup on both sides of the ball, which made it the pick as favorite in the Lackawanna Football Conference Division I. North Pocono has won the only two meetings between the two programs by a combined score of 83-7. 3-RIVERSIDE AT 7-DUNMORE When: Friday, 7 p.m. Where: Dunmore Veterans Memorial Stadium. Last: Riverside, 24-6 (2024). The buzz: Dunmore was the coach’s pick as the favorite in the LFC Division II. Riverside earned the […]

shorts.title: Serving Seniors celebrates 50 years, honors Alice McDonnell
shorts.title_distilled: Serving Seniors celebrates 50 years, honors Alice McDonnell.
shorts.description: Serving Seniors Inc., a nonprofit leader in advocating for and protecting vulnerable older adults in Northeast Pennsylvania, will celebrate its 50th anniversary with a commemorative dinner on Thursday, Oct. 9, at 5:30 p.m. at La Buona Vita in Dunmore. Founded in the early 1970s as Interfaith Friends, the organization began as a grassroots coalition of faith leaders and volunteers working to improve the quality of life for those in long-term care facilities. In 1975, the group formally reorganized as Serving Seniors, expanding its mission to include a broad range of services aimed at empowering and protecting older adults across the […]
shorts.content: Serving Seniors Inc., a nonprofit leader in advocating for and protecting vulnerable older adults in Northeast Pennsylvania, will celebrate its 50th anniversary with a commemorative dinner on Thursday, Oct. 9, at 5:30 p.m. at La Buona Vita in Dunmore. Founded in the early 1970s as Interfaith Friends, the organization began as a grassroots coalition of faith leaders and volunteers working to improve the quality of life for those in long-term care facilities. In 1975, the group formally reorganized as Serving Seniors, expanding its mission to include a broad range of services aimed at empowering and protecting older adults across the […]

shorts.title: GAMEFACE: Game of the Week, 2-Scranton Prep at 9-Valley View
shorts.title_distilled: GAMEFACE: Game of the Week, 2-Scranton Prep at 9-Valley View.
shorts.description: The best way to start a season is with a long-standing rivalry. No. 2 Scranton Prep visits No. 9 Valley View, featuring programs with impressive histories, including District 2 titles last season. In addition, the matchup is the first game that counts toward the Lackawanna Football Conference Division I championship. The Cavaliers opened the 2024 campaign with a 33-0 win over Valley View on the way to the District 2 Class 3A and LFC Division I crowns. Valley View recovered from that setback, won 11 straight games and captured the District 2 Class 4A gold. Since 2015, Scranton Prep won […]
shorts.content: The best way to start a season is with a long-standing rivalry.
